pullrequest.title: Compile examples in pipeline, fix common.hh

content.raw: Strictly speaking, we probably don't want it to be. Since this is a file that has essentially been borrowed from another codebase, it's probably best to keep its header guard the same. I would think of it like this: "`DIRENT_H` is the header guard macro which protects the definition of the `dirent` struct". If we change the header guard macro, then we would risk a redefinition error if we ever had both `#include "win_dirent.h"` and also `#include "dirent.h"`.
content.html: Strictly speaking, we probably don't want it to be. Since this is a file that has essentially been borrowed from another codebase, it's probably best to keep its header guard the same. I would think of it like this: "DIRENT_H is the header guard macro which protects the definition of the dirent struct". If we change the header guard macro, then we would risk a redefinition error if we ever had both #include "win_dirent.h" and also #include "dirent.h".
